title: Lions' Branch suspended one game for fight
content: The NFL has suspended Lions safety Brian Branch for one game without pay after he struck Chiefs wide receiver JuJu Smith-Schuster and set off a brief fight.

title: Titans fire coach Callahan, name McCoy interim
content: The Titans have fired Brian Callahan just six games into his second season as the team's head coach. He finishes with a 4-19 record as the team's coach.

title: Sources: NBA OK'd Clips' Aspiration patch deal
content: The NBA vetted and approved a $300 million sponsorship deal between the Los Angeles Clippers and Aspiration in 2021, before the company signed a separate deal with Kawhi Leonard that triggered an investigation by the league, multiple sources told ESPN.

title: Dolphins' McDaniel: Tua's comments 'misguided'
content: Tua Tagovailoa's comments after Sunday's game were "misguided," and his postgame news conference was not "not the forum" to air his concerns, coach Mike McDaniel said Monday.

title: Belichick calls UNC exit rumors 'categorically false'
content: After a week of chaos surrounding North Carolina and Bill Belichick's future, the six-time Super Bowl-winning coach denied rumors he was looking for an exit and doubled down on his belief that his "process" will eventually lead to a winning team.

title: Purdue tops preseason AP Top 25 poll for 1st time
content: Purdue is No. 1 in the preseason Associated Press Top 25 college basketball poll for the first time. The Boilermakers earned 35 of 61 first-place votes to top Monday's poll to begin the 2025-26 season.

title: Nebraska's Rhule doesn't squelch Penn State talk
content: Matt Rhule professed his love for living and working in Nebraska and trying to return the Cornhuskers to the upper echelon of college football. But he did nothing to shut down speculation that he could be up for the Penn State job.

title: Tomlin questions Browns' trade of Flacco to Cincy
content: Steelers coach Mike Tomlin on Monday openly questioned the Browns and general manager Andrew Berry for the decision to execute a midseason trade sending quarterback Joe Flacco to the Bengals, saying, "It doesn't make sense."

title: üèÄ NBA big-three tiers: Ranking teams' core trios
content: Who has the top core trio in the NBA? Which teams' big threes are on the rise, and which need work? ESPN's Tim Bontemps breaks it down in 10 tiers.

title: Why the Falcons are confident Michael Penix Jr. is ready for his MNF debut
content: Penix is coming off his best game as the second-year QB rewards Atlanta's faith in taking him in the first round.

title: Jayden Daniels and the QB battle that unlocked his greatness
content: Daniels was third on the depth chart when he transferred to LSU. This is how he won the QB battle and unlocked his potential.

title: Inside Caleb Williams vs. Jayden Daniels 2.0: A year after the Hail Mary
content: Daniels' numbers aren't as good as last year's while Williams' accuracy remains an issue; can either find a fix?

title: How the 2025 NLCS could decide if baseball is played in 2027
content: The big-money Dodgers and small-market Brewers exemplify two sides of the MLB payroll divide -- a fact no one will forget next spring.

title: WNBA's CBA negotiations: Everything to know with deadline looming
content: The CBA expires Oct. 31. Here are the biggest issues and how WNBA players' criticisms of Cathy Engelbert might impact negotiations.

title: AP men's hoops preseason poll: Breaking down all Top 25 teams
content: Here's what to know about each team in the AP men's preseason Top 25, from No. 1 Purdue to No. 25 North Carolina.

title: The rise of Curt Cignetti, the fall of James Franklin and other midseason thoughts
content: Bill Connelly looks at both ends of the coaching world, plus the top players, the Heisman race and more.

title: Checking the temperature of the NFL's hottest seats: Barnwell on Mike McDaniel, Justin Fields
content: Should the Dolphins or Ravens make coaching changes? Is it time for a QB switch for the Jets? Might the Eagles consider moves in their secondary?

title: Questions, takeaways: Mahomes' TDs lead Chiefs; Panthers, Chargers win thrillers
content: Our NFL Nation reporters answer the biggest questions out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 6.

title: How USMNT, USWNT choose opponents, venues and prices for games
content: USMNT and USWNT fans often complain about high ticket prices, repetitive cities and weak opponents for games, but U.S. Soccer explains everything that goes into such decisions.

title: Pickups: Vidal steps up; Dart, Darnold being underrated
content: Highlighting free agent options after some big performances this weekend and to help with injury concerns ahead of Week 7.

title: Buzz from Sunday: Nacua, Egbuka injuries and a peek at Moody's game notes
content: Stephania Bell takes a closer look at the injuries from Sunday; Eric Moody shares his most interesting notes

title: Penn State fires James Franklin: Top candidates, transfers and recruits
content: After two shocking losses, Penn State is looking for a new coach. The job quickly becomes the best in this cycle.

title: Who is going to the World Series? Expert predictions for ALCS, NLCS
content: The Dodgers, Brewers, Blue Jays and Mariners remain. Here's who we think will move on -- and how our playoff predictions have fared so far.

title: First bets for Week 7: Buccaneers' luck runs out vs. Lions, Giants cover in Denver
content: What lines offered immediate value once odds came out? Here are five early bets and a futures wager to track.

title: College football: Ole Miss-Georgia, Tennessee-Alabama lead Top 25 matchups
content: There are five ranked matchups next weekend -- the most in any week this season -- with three in the SEC.

title: WWE 'Raw' takeaways: The Vision is blurred
content: Seth Rollins was blindsided when The Vision teammates Bron Breakker and Bronson Reed betrayed him at 'Raw.'

title: Premier League big issues: Will Amorim, Ange last? Is Salah a fading force?
content: The Premier League returns this weekend. With four matchdays until the next international break, what are the big issues looming over the next month?

title: Dutch-born players are making Suriname's World Cup dreams a reality
content: Due to a change in FIFA rules, Suriname is drawing on its Dutch lineage to earn a spot in the 2026 World Cup.

title: Transfer rumors, news: AC Milan focused on Liverpool's Joe Gomez
content: AC Milan want to sign an experienced center back, and Liverpool's Joe Gomez is their main target. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Naidu invites Modi for ‚ÄòSuper GST ‚Äì Super Savings‚Äô¬†event in Kurnool and CII Partnership Summit in Vizag
content: The Prime Minister‚Äôs participation in the CII Partnership Summit 2025 will inspire investors to strengthen India‚Äôs economic resurgence, says the Chief Minister

title: Minister Kirti Vardhan Singh attends Gaza Peace Summit, reaffirms India's support for peace plan
content: The Gaza peace summit was co-hosted by U.S. President Donald Trump and Egyptian President Abdel Fattah Al-Sisi and was joined by several world leaders

title: In a show of strength in Eknath Shinde‚Äôs fortress, Shiv Sena UBT and MNS hold a joint rally in Thane
content: Both parties, along with Sharad Pawar‚Äôs NCP, staged a protest against alleged corruption and mismanagement in Thane Municipal Corporation

title: India-Australia joint military exercise AUSTRAHIND begins in Perth
content: Being held from October 13 to 26, this year‚Äôs edition focuses on counter-terrorism operations in urban and semi-urban terrain, reflecting the evolving nature of modern conflict, says the Indian Army.

title: Bulk LPG transporters strike: oil marketing companies continue to manage supplies in State
content: A senior official of an OMC says the is no need to panic as all three companies have enough cylinders in stock

title: Congress to boycott JPC on Bills to sack PM, CMs
content: The Lok Sabha had passed a resolution to refer the bills to the joint committee soon after Union Home Minister Amit Shah had introduced the bill in the Lower House on August 20

title: SC says Singur land meant for ‚Äògenuinely defenceless‚Äô, denies restoration to industrial units
content: A Bench of Justices Surya Kant and Joymalya Bagchi clarifies the scope of the court‚Äôs 2016 ruling in Kedar Nath Yadav v. State of West Bengal, which had quashed the acquisition proceedings for the Tata Motors plant and directed that the land be returned to its original owners within 12 weeks

title: Afghan Hindus, Sikhs meet Muttaqi, urge restoration of religious places
content: Community members requested the Taliban government to consider appointing Afghan Hindus or Sikhs at their mission in India to strengthen bilateral ties

title: Hike in PF pension under consideration of Cabinet: Minister
content: To enhance ease of living of EPF members, CBT decided to simplify the partial withdrawal provisions of EPF Scheme by merging 13 complex provisions into a single, streamlined rule categorised into three types namely, Essential Needs (illness, education, marriage), Housing Needs, and Special Circumstances

title: Congress questions omission of reference to RSS in FIR registered over Kerala IT professional‚Äôs death
content: A note that surfaced on his social media account had alleged sexual abuse in camps organised by the RSS; the organisation too has called for a probe into his death, calling the incident ‚Äòsad and unfortunate‚Äô    ¬†

title: Asian, African countries keen to emulate Kochi Water Metro
content: Kochi Water Metro Limited awaiting Euro 24 million additional loan from German lending agency KfW to extend operations

title: Supreme Court seeks Centre‚Äôs response on status of implementation of 2017 palliative care guidelines
content: Petition has sought directions to make palliative care accessible to terminally ill persons as part of national health programme

title: Notorious criminal shot dead in police encounter in Meerut
content: Shahzad, who had been evading arrest for nine months, had seven cases registered against him, including charges of rape

title: Tej Pratap Yadav announces 21 JJD candidates
content: Lalu Prasad Yadav‚Äôs estranged older son, founder of the Janshakti Janata Dal, also announced his own candidature from the Mahua Assembly seat

title: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin inaugurates mega food parks in Villupuram, Theni districts
content: The Chief Minister also opens Aran Illams ‚Äî homes for transpersons established in Shenoy Nagar in Chennai and in Anna Nagar in Madurai at ‚Çπ43 lakh

title: Government will build a sports city with international standards at Amaravati, says Home Minister
content: Inaugurates national-level police weightlifting competition, which will see 32 teams from different States and Union Territories participating in the five-day evet

title: Bihar election 2025: Mahagatbandhan fails to arrive at seat-sharing formula acceptable to all allies
content: RJD‚Äôs chief holds two rounds of meeting with Congress leadership in Delhi but fails to break the deadlock; Congress insisting on 70 seats that it fought in 2020; RJD argues that with more constituents in grand alliance

title: Bhutan should compensate for North Bengal floods, says Mamata
content: West Bengal Chief Minister reiterates demand for setting up Indo-Bhutan¬†Joint River Commission, says State officials will attend meeting scheduled on October 16

title: Number of births declines; deaths rise slightly: report
content: There were 2.52 crore births in 2023, around 2.32 lakh fewer than in 2022. The Vital Statistics of India based on Civil Registration System (CRS) report for the year 2023 shows 86.6 lakh deaths were registered in 2023, a marginal increase from 86.5 lakh deaths in 2022.

title: Supreme Court refuses to quash FIR against folk singer for posts on PM
content: The court said it was not inclined to interfere at this stage but clarified that the singer could raise her objections when charges are framed before the trial court

title: Kashmir‚Äôs Baramulla district bans use of drones after Army raises alarm¬†
content: The Army has expressed fears following intelligence inputs that there was a possibility that drones would be smuggled into the Kashmir Valley

title: With women‚Äôs vote proving decisive, NDA goes all out to garner support
content: The lessons of the previous Assembly election and the 2024 Lok Sabha polls are very much on the minds of poll strategists in the ruling alliance; with women considered a particularly ‚Äòcasteless‚Äô voting bloc, it is little wonder that the NDA govt. in the State has rolled out schemes targeted at them

title: Idol Wing steps up efforts to recover three idols from U.K., Netherlands, and Singapore
content: The Idol Wing has been corresponding with foreign museums, the Union Ministry of Culture, and the respective foreign offices to recover the idols of Thirumangai Alwar, Kannappa Nayanar, and Hanuman

title: Bihar Court issues summonses to Rahul, Tejashwi over hurling of 'abuse' at PM Modi
content: The CJM has ordered Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, RJD‚Äôs Tejashwi Yadav, and Mukesh Sahani of the Vikassheel Insaan Party to appear before the court in person or through their legal representatives on November 26

title: Haryana IPS officer death: Authorities meet officer‚Äôs wife over autopsy
content: The SIT probing the case has sent a letter to the deceased officer‚Äôs wife, requesting her ‚Äúto come forward for identification of the body for the conduct of the PME (postmortem) at the earliest‚Äù

title: CM Pinarayi rejects media reports of ED summoning his son in 2023 on suspicion of money laundering
content: Pinarayi says adverse newspaper headlines and accusatory news chyrons on television channels will not deter him from taking the derogatory allegations aimed at causing him political and reputational damage head-on

title: B-SMILE drafts DPRs for 13 elevated corridors in Bengaluru worth ‚Çπ18,000 cr.
content: The initial proposal, submitted to the government in 2024, included building elevated corridors covering 110 km, estimated to cost around ‚Çπ13,200 crore, excluding land acquisition

title: Panel to be set up for Polytechnic modernisation
content: The course in Cinematography and Sound Recording & Engineering was originally introduced in 1943 at Sri Jayachamarajendra Government Polytechnic as a result of the foresight of M.Visvesvaraya. In 1996, this course was renamed and relocated to Hesaraghatta, where it was spread across 25 acres, as the Government Film and Television Institute with assistance from the World Bank.

title: Citizen response programme will give Kerala a new sense of direction, says Pinarayi
content: Under the programme, scheduled from January 1 to February 28, 2026, volunteers will reach out to people, listen to their opinions and suggestions and prepare reports which will form the blueprint of Kerala‚Äôs path to progress

title: Actor-playwright Raju Talikoti passes away
content: He suffered a heart attack on Sunday night and passed away at KMC Hospital in Manipal of Udupi district on Monday evening

title: BJP steps up attack on RJD after setback in IRCTC scam case
content: At a press conference, senior BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad urges the people of Bihar ‚Äònever to be taken in by Tejashwi Yadav‚Äôs promises, because jobs will not be provided and your land will be taken‚Äô

title: Onion glut triggers price crash in Dindigul wholesale market
content: About 10 days ago, the market at Dindigul received 250 tonnes of onion and the price was fixed at ‚Çπ25 a kg. On Monday, a fresh stock of 300 tonnes arrived triggering a crash in price

title: Amoebic meningoencephalitis confirmed in two children in Kerala
content: Health officials confirmed that 40 persons are undergoing treatment for amoebic meningoencephalitis in public and private hospitals across the State

title: Minibus hits culvert near Ongole, one dead
content: The police officials rescued 19 occupants of the minibus which  hit a culvert, overturned and fell into a canal

title: Sharjeel Imam seeks two-week bail to contest Bihar election
content: Lodged in Tihar jail for over five years and awaiting trial in a larger conspiracy case related to north-east Delhi Riots 2020, Imam seeks to contest as an Independent candidate from Bahadurganj constituency in his home State.

title: Kandukur farmers cry foul over compensation in NH 167B land acquisition
content: Nearly 30 farmers from Kanumalla, Palukuru and Oguru panchayats write letters to Chief Minister, Deputy CM, IT and R&B ministers demanding compensation as per the existing market value of the land

title:
Janata Dal(U) is no longer alone in the driving seat
in NDA in Bihar
content: With the JD(U) and the BJP contesting on 101 seats each, the dominance of Nitish Kumar‚Äôs party in the alliance is on the wane; though Mr. Kumar still remains at the helm of the NDA in Bihar, concerns about his health and age bother voters, some on whom want the leader to make way for someone younger

title: Minister Kirti Singh Meets Trump In Egypt, Reaffirms India's Support For Gaza
content: Minister of State for External Affairs Kirti Vardhan Singh [MOS (KVS)] attended the Sharm El-Sheikh Peace Summit held in Sharm El-Sheikh, Egypt, on October 13, as per an official statement by the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA).

title: Video: "You Don't Mind Being Called Beautiful, Right?" Trump To Italy's Meloni
content: US President Donald Trump had some choice words for Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, the only female leader on stage at a Gaza summit in Egypt on Monday: "She's beautiful."

title: Shehbaz Sharif Behind Him, Trump Praises "Very Good Friend" PM Modi In Egypt
content: US President Donald Trump on Monday praised India and Prime Minister Narendra Modi without naming him, saying "India is a great country with a good friend of mine at the top".

title: Several Killed As Clashes Erupt Between Hamas And Gaza Clan After Ceasefire: Report
content: Several people were killed over the weekend in Gaza City in violent clashes between Hamas security forces and the members of an armed clan, multiple sources reported on Monday.

title: Opinion: Opinion | CBI Probe Into Karur Double-Edged Sword For Vijay's Party, Blow For DMK
content: The Supreme Court's order for a court-monitored CBI probe into the tragic loss of 41 lives at a political rally held by actor-turned-politician Vijay's Tamizha Vetri Kazhagam is expected to have a big impact on the fierce political exchange.

title: Tamil Nadu Man, 24, Hacked To Death By Father-In-Law 3 Months After Wedding
content: A 24-year-old man was hacked to death, allegedly by his father-in-law, in Tamil Nadu's Dindigul district, just three months after he married the latter's daughter. As per the police, it was an inter-caste marriage.

title: 'Gaza Deal Brings Hope For Ukraine': Zelensky
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Monday hailed the "extraordinary" Gaza ceasefire as bringing hope that US President Donald Trump could broker an end to the Russian invasion of his country.

title: "What We Asked For": Vijay After Court Orders CBI Probe Into Tamil Nadu Stampede
content: Hours after the Supreme Court ordered a Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) probe into the Tamil Nadu stampede tragedy that killed 41 people, actor-turned-politician Vijay said he hoped "justice will prevail".

title: 'Ready When You Are': Trump To Tehran On Nuclear Deal With Iran
content: The United States is prepared to make a deal with Iran when Tehran is ready, US President Donald Trump said in a speech to the Israeli parliament on Monday.

title: Dalit Groups Withdraw Protest, But Ambedkar Statue Row Still Simmering
content: Several Dalit organizations of Madhya Pradesh have withdrawn from the October 15 protest in Gwalior amid a huge row over a lawyer's comment on Dalit icon and architect of the Constitution BR Ambedkar.

title: Major Road Collapse In Madhya Pradesh Leaves 30-Foot-Deep Crater
content: A major portion of a road near a village in Madhya Pradesh collapsed on Monday afternoon, resulting in a 30-foot-deep crater.

title: Minister Kirti Singh Joins World Leaders At Gaza Peace Summit In Egypt
content: Kirti Vardhan Singh, Minister of State for External Affairs and Environment, Forest and Climate Change, represented India at the Sharm El-Sheikh Peace Summit on Monday.

title: Tejashwi Yadav's RJD May Contest 135 Seats, Congress 61 In Bihar: Sources
content: Bihar's opposition Grand Alliance, bickering over assembly seats for weeks, has finally come to an arrangement that involves marginal climbdown for both Lalu Yadav's Rashtriya Janata Dal and the Congress, sources said

title: Minister Urges Need To Change Commitments To Actions Ahead Of Key Climate Meet
content: Union Minister Bhupender Yadav urged that COP30 to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, be a landmark "COP of Adaptation" to turn global climate promises into real-world solutions.

title: CCTV Shows Cops Chasing, Beating Engineering Student Hours Before His Death
content: New CCTV footage obtained exclusively by NDTV has intensified outrage over the brutal assault that ended in the death of an engineering student in Madhya Pradesh's Sonagiri last week.

title: Water Crisis At South Delhi's 2 Iconic Malls? What Authorities Said
content: DLF clarified that two of its malls - DLF Promenade and DLF Emporio - are fully functional, denying claims that they might face closure amid the festive season owing to water supply issues.

title: Israel-Hamas Ceasefire LIVE Updates -"It's Going To Hold Up": Trump On Gaza Ceasefire Declaration
content: Israel Gaza Ceasefire LIVE Updates: US President Donald Trump and regional leaders signed a declaration Monday meant to cement a ceasefire in Gaza, hours after Israel and Hamas exchanged hostages and prisoners.

title: "Tremendous Day For Mideast": Trump After Signing Gaza Declaration
content: US President Donald Trump hailed a "tremendous day for the Middle East" as he and regional leaders signed a declaration Monday meant to cement a ceasefire in Gaza, hours after Israel and Hamas exchanged hostages and prisoners.

title: Diwali 2025 Likely To Witness Record Rs 5 Lakh Crore Trade: Traders' Body
content: India is likely to witness its biggest-ever festive business season this Diwali, with total trade expected to cross Rs 5 lakh crore, according to the Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT).

title: Gaza deal: Trump signs peace plan, hostages exchanged, Israeli troops return ‚Äî what‚Äôs next?
content: A landmark Gaza peace deal, brokered by the US and regional leaders, was signed in Egypt, facilitating a hostage-prisoner exchange. While initial phases saw hostage releases and aid surges, critical issues like Hamas disarmament, postwar governance, and Palestinian statehood remain contentious. The fragile agreement faces significant hurdles for full implementation.

title: 'India is a great country': Donald Trump lauds 'friend' PM Modi in Gaza peace summit
content: US President Donald Trump praised Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi as a "very good friend" at the Sharm el-Sheikh Summit, expressing optimism for improved India-Pakistan relations.  The remarks followed a historic peace agreement for Gaza, with both leaders discussing trade progress and Trump inviting Pakistan's PM to speak.

title: Google VP of Product not happy With Silicon Valley's love for small teams; says they are 'wrong' because‚Ä¶
content: Google VP Robby Stein warns against Silicon Valley's "cult" of lean teams, arguing that underinvestment kills promising products. He emphasizes that foundational AI breakthroughs require scale and patience, and teams should transition from scrappiness to scaling once internal conviction and external user validation are achieved. Stein advocates for building capable teams to create strong product versions, not just the smallest ones.

title: Ouch! KL Rahul cries out in pain after ball strikes him on the box ‚Äì Watch
content: Indian opener KL Rahul endured a painful blow to the groin from a 134 kph delivery on Day 4 of the second Test against West Indies. Despite the incident, Rahul showed resilience, remaining unbeaten on 25 as India closed at 63/1, needing just 58 more runs for a series sweep.

title: 'You don‚Äôt mind right?': Trump calls Meloni 'beautiful young woman' in Gaza peace summit
content: At the Gaza Peace Summit, US President Donald Trump complimented Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni's appearance, calling her a "beautiful young woman." He then praised her political success and effectiveness.

title: Digital rights debate: SC rejects doctor‚Äôs WhatsApp plea; suggests Zoho‚Äôs Arattai
content: The Supreme Court of India has ruled that access to private messaging platforms like WhatsApp is not a fundamental right. A doctor's petition seeking restoration of her blocked account was dismissed, with the court suggesting alternative apps like Zoho's Arattai. The ruling emphasizes that users must adhere to platform policies for privately operated services.

title: ‚ÄòThis took 3,000 years': Trump signs Gaza peace deal in Egypt summit
content: US President Donald Trump and regional leaders signed a landmark Gaza peace deal in Egypt, hailed as a historic step toward regional stability. The comprehensive agreement formalizes frameworks for ceasefire implementation, humanitarian assistance, and longer-term peace talks between Israel and Palestinian authorities.  The summit, co-chaired by Trump and Egyptian President El-Sisi, saw participation from numerous world leaders.

title: Tech crash: Trump‚Äôs China tariffs causes $770 bn wipeout from Amazon, Nvidia, Tesla
content: Tech giants like Amazon, Nvidia, and Tesla faced a massive $770 billion market value drop following President Trump's threat of 100% tariffs on China and export controls.  This significant market downturn, the worst since April, also impacted the Nasdaq and S&P 500, with Bitcoin experiencing a sharp decline as well.

title: MLB legend Sandy Alomar Sr. dies at 81, father of Hall of Famer Roberto Alomar and Sandy Jr.
content: Sandy Alomar Sr., a 15-season MLB veteran and 1970 All-Star, has passed away at 81. Known for his speed and defense, Alomar Sr. also had a significant coaching career and was the father of MLB stars Sandy Alomar Jr. and Hall of Famer Roberto Alomar. His extensive contributions to baseball spanned over five decades.

title: Patrick Mahomes boycott rumor: The truth behind viral Bad Bunny post
content: Viral claims that Patrick Mahomes would boycott the 2026 Super Bowl over Bad Bunny's halftime show and join Turning Point USA are false. Mahomes has made no such statements regarding Bad Bunny or the political group. His wife, Brittany, made a general comment about hate after Charlie Kirk's death, but Mahomes himself remains apolitical.

title: Report: Taylor Swift, Blake Lively reunite; Travis Kelce quietly present
content: Whispers suggest Taylor Swift and Blake Lively have rekindled their friendship after months of rumored distance, fueled by Lively's recent lawsuit drama. Swift's new song, 'CANCELLED!', is believed to be a tribute to Lively's public struggles. This potential reunion hints at Swift rebalancing her life amidst her relationship with Travis Kelce and her global tour.

title: CeeDee Lamb injury: Cowboys WR‚Äôs Week 7 status vs Washington uncertain
content: Dallas Cowboys' star receiver CeeDee Lamb is nearing a potential return in Week 7 after a three-game absence due to a high-ankle sprain. While his status remains uncertain, positive recovery signs are encouraging. Meanwhile, George Pickens has stepped up significantly, becoming a primary offensive threat and keeping the Cowboys' passing game potent.

title: 'Pak thought it could do anything': CDS Chauhan on Operation Sindoor
content: Chief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan stated India cannot tolerate even the threat of a nuclear attack, citing Operation Sindoor's success in proving Pakistan's nuclear assumptions wrong. He emphasised that nation-building is a collective effort, with the entire country fighting wars, not just the armed forces.

title: Trump pauses speech, asks Pak PM to say 'few words'; Sharif kowtows ceasefire claim
content: US President Donald Trump unexpectedly invited Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif to speak at the Sharm el-Sheikh Summit on Gaza. Sharif lauded Trump as a "man of peace," praising his efforts in achieving a Gaza ceasefire and previously de-escalating tensions between India and Pakistan.

title: Unexpected drama! Girl slaps boy in stands during IND vs WI Test
content: During the India vs. West Indies Test, an unusual off-field incident saw a girl physically confront a boy in the stands, captured by broadcast cameras and quickly going viral. While the match saw India in a strong position to win, the fan altercation dominated online discussions about crowd behavior.

title: NFL game turns into a love story: Colts cheerleader Mika gets on-field proposal
content: During a thrilling Colts game, cheerleader Mika received an unforgettable surprise as her boyfriend, Spencer, proposed on the field. Amidst thousands of cheering fans and her teammates' support, Mika tearfully accepted, turning a football match into a viral moment of pure joy. The heartwarming proposal, captured on video, has captivated NFL fans nationwide.

title: Cars to fighter planes: Xi's shock & awe gambit - will Trump blink first?
content: China has imposed sweeping export controls on critical materials like rare earths and electric motors, impacting global supply chains from cars to defense systems. This move escalates the trade conflict, prompting US President Trump to threaten further tariffs and export restrictions. The situation highlights a new phase of economic confrontation with significant implications for international trade and security.

title: 'Dawn of new Middle East': Trump paints rosy picture after Gaza deal ‚Äî too soon to cheer?
content: US President Donald Trump declared a "long and painful nightmare" over for Israel, announcing a Gaza ceasefire and Hamas disarmament. He hailed the unprecedented regional endorsement of the plan, marking a "historic dawn of a new Middle East." Trump also praised Prime Minister Netanyahu, calling for his pardon amid legal challenges and celebrating the return of Israeli hostages.

title: Apple's former CEO John Sculley 'confirms' Tim Cook may be planning to retire
content: Former Apple CEO John Sculley suggests Tim Cook might retire soon, emphasizing the need for a successor to guide Apple into the 'agentic era' beyond apps. Sculley also identified OpenAI as Apple's first significant competitor in years, highlighting a shift towards subscription models and smart agents over numerous applications.

title: Ayesha Curry shows off golf skills, sparks talk of switch from NBA life
content: NBA star Stephen Curry's wife, Ayesha, is showcasing impressive golf skills, recently sharing her progress with a new coach on Instagram. While Steph was absent from her latest practice, likely due to the NBA preseason schedule, he has previously enjoyed golf outings with her, even sharing his playlists. Curry is actively working on his own golf game after a slump.

title: Arson, clashes, chaos: Pak gripped by violence as TLP protest turns ugly ‚Äî key points
content: Pakistan grapples with escalating unrest following a significant crackdown on the Tehreek-e-Labbaik Pakistan (TLP). Authorities detained hundreds and sealed routes to halt a planned march to Islamabad, with the TLP accusing police of using lethal force. The group, protesting in solidarity with Palestine and against recognizing Israel, reported numerous casualties and injuries amid violent clashes.

title: 'Leave GT, join CSK': Fan's message to Sai Sudharsan after viral burger clip - Watch
content: Sai Sudharsan, the Gujarat Titans' Orange Cap winner, is generating significant buzz ahead of the IPL 2026 auction. A viral fan video from a recent Test match fueled speculation about a potential move to Chennai Super Kings, his hometown team. His consistent performances and Tamil Nadu roots make him a prime target for CSK.

title: EPFO allows up to 100% part PF withdrawal: Digital services simplified
content: EPFO has significantly liberalized partial withdrawal rules, allowing subscribers up to 100% of their EPF balance for essential needs, housing, and special circumstances. Minimum service for withdrawals is now 12 months. The organization also introduced a scheme to reduce litigation and a digital transformation plan for faster, automated services, enhancing ease of living for millions.

title: 'Welcome release of all hostages': PM Modi pledges support for Trump's Gaza plan
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi welcomed the Gaza peace deal and the release of hostages held for over two years. He lauded the families' courage and the peace efforts of President Trump and Prime Minister Netanyahu. This development follows a devastating conflict initiated by Hamas attacks on October 7, 2023, and Israel's subsequent military response.

title: When was the last time a Test in India went into Day 5?
content: India stands on the brink of a series whitewash against West Indies, needing just 58 runs to win the second Test. Despite a strong fightback from the visitors, highlighted by centuries from Shai Hope and John Campbell, India's bowlers, led by Kuldeep Yadav and Jasprit Bumrah, eventually gained control.  KL Rahul and Sai Sudharsan are set to finish the job.

title: Pakistan Hockey warns before India clash - 'If India don't shake hands '
content: Pakistan's hockey federation has cautioned its junior team against engaging with Indian players during their Sultan of Johor Cup match. Following a similar incident in cricket, Pakistani players are instructed to ignore potential non-handshakes and avoid any on-field altercations. The federation stresses maintaining focus on the game amidst these diplomatic tensions.

title: Chloe Kitts injury: South Carolina star out for 2025-26 after medical emergency
content: South Carolina's Chloe Kitts will miss the entire 2025-26 season after tearing her ACL. The senior, an honorable mention All-American and MVP of the NCAA Birmingham 2 Regional and SEC Tournament, will undergo surgery this week. Coach Dawn Staley expressed disappointment but confidence in her team's ability to step up.

title: Kannada actor-comedian Raju Talikote passes away due to cardiac arrest - Report
content: Legendary actor and comedian Raju Talikote breathed his last at Manipal Hospital in Udupi, succumbing to complications from age and a heart attack. Renowned for his memorable performances as a comedic drunkard, Talikote had just wrapped filming on a new project. His family has announced that his farewell ceremonies will take place in Vijayapura.

title: Top 5 sectors reshaping jobs in 2025: Tech and green skills surge; new roles emerge
content: The India Skills Report 2025 reveals the top five sectors reshaping workforce needs globally, highlighting growing demand for digital skills and renewable energy roles. Technology, healthcare, fintech, renewable energy, and e-commerce are driving job growth across key regions. The report emphasises the importance of upskilling and formal employment to meet evolving talent demands, positioning India as a major player in the global workforce transformation by 2025.

title: Mohammed Siraj collapses after long spell, receives 'king-like' treatment - See pic
content: Delhi's intense heat overwhelmed Indian pacer Mohammed Siraj, causing him to collapse from exhaustion during the second Test against the West Indies. After a demanding spell, he received immediate medical attention.  Despite the challenging conditions and the West Indies' strong batting performance, India is poised for a series victory.

title: One thing you shouldn't be surprised by ... for every NBA team
content: if he gets hurt again, we must reevaluate. PF/SF Jayson Tatum is out for much of the season . SG/PG Derrick White will see a career-best in shots .

title: Projecting the CFP top 12 at midseason: Buckeyes the team to beat
content: Ohio State has emerged as the clear favorite in "SportsCenter" at the midpoint of the season, Penn State has three losses . Texas is trying to claw its way back into the playoff conversation, and undefeated Indiana is a top five team . the battle for no. 1 is ongoing .

title: AP Week 7 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: the top two teams in the poll stayed steady but there was movement not far below . then-no. 7 Indiana went to then no. 3 Oregon and notched a big win to declare themselves as legitimate national title contenders . Alabama and Ole Miss squeaked out wins . now they are atop the SEC alongside Texas A&M .

title: An NBA dynasty reborn? Why the Warriors could be more dangerous than you think
content: the Golden State Warriors have just the seventh-best odds to win the West this season . they are behind the defending champions Oklahoma City Thunder, Denver Nuggets, Houston Rockets , los Angeles Lakers , Minnesota Timberwolves and LA Clippers . if Buddy Hield joins Stephen Curry , Jimmy Butler III , Draymond Green and Al Horford in the starting lineup .

title: Julio Rodriguez's three-run HR gives Mariners early Game 2 lead
content: The  Seattle Mariners  got off to a strong start in Game 2 of the American Champions League Series on Monday courtesy of  Julio Rodriguez . The center fielder smashed an 84 mph splitter off  Trey Yesavage  for a three-run homer in the top of the first inning. The  Toronto Blue Jays  right-hander had never allowed an extra-base hit on the splitter before, according to ESPN Research. It marked Rodriguez's second home run of the postseason as Seattle looks to take a 2-0 lead in the series. JULIO RODR√çGUEZ 3-RUN HOMER!  #ALCS   pic.twitter.com/LdnHOBG3P2 The blast was Yesavage's first career home run allowed in his fifth career start (regular season and playoffs). Entering Monday, he had allowed only two extra-base hits in 19‚Öì innings pitched. Seattle trailed 1-0 in the first inning in Game 1 before bouncing back to win  3-1  on Sunday. The series shifts to Seattle on Wednesday. ESPN Research contributed to this report.

title: Power Rankings: Indiana climbs into top 3; four new teams join the Top 25
content: Oklahoma can still make the playoffs even with a loss to Texas . Ohio State allowed a whopping 16 points at Illinois, seven more than it had in any other game this season . the most dominant team is looking for areas to improve as the midpoint of 2025 season arrives .

title: Brewers or Dodgers? Blue Jays or Mariners? What final four must do to reach Fall Classic
content: the 2025 league championship series is set for a trip to the world series on the line . the next day, the defending champion Los Angeles Dodgers and top-seeded Milwaukee Brewers will begin their series on a national league side of the bracket .

title: The race to the 2026 World Cup: Cape Verde book first-ever finals appearance
content: all confederations are drawing to a close, but we're still a long way from discovering the full list of 45 nations that will join hosts United States , Mexico and Canada to make up the field of 48 . the final two rounds of the group stage take place in October, when we will discover the seven nations joining Morocco and Tunisia .

title: Falcons and Bills throwbacks, Commanders' all-black top NFL Week 6 threads
content: the Atlanta Falcons are rocking their throwback uniforms against the Buffalo Bills . the iconic helmet was reintroduced in 2022 with the old school Falcons logo . in the second game of a "Monday Night Football" doubleheader, the Washington Commanders are wearing their all-black alternates against a Chicago Bears game .

title: NFL Week 6's top performance? Vote for the 'Himmy' Award winner
content: "sunday night football" doubleheader features the Buffalo Bills vs. the Chicago Bears at the Washington Commanders . this week's "HIMMY" award nominees are: Patrick Mahomes, Baker Mayfield, Drake Maye .

title: Kargil group demands release of Wangchuk, others

title: Not a single appeal filed so far against Bihar rolls: Chief electoral officer
content: a single appeal has been filed against the inclusion or exclusion of any person in the final roll . the state chief electoral officer shared in a social media update on monday . if the appellant remains unsatisfied with the district magistrate ruling, he can file a second and final appeal .

title: Supreme Court seeks response of Centre, TN & Kerala on safety audit of Mullaperiyar
content: a bench of CJI B R Gavai and justice K Vinod Chandran sought responses from both states and the centre . the 'Save Kerala Brigade' petition expressed concern over the dam, located in a seismic zone, posing a serious threat to the lives of 10 million people living downstream .

title: Hang them, says dad of BTech grad beaten to death by MP cops
content: a 21-year-old BTech graduate out partying with friends in a car died after alleged thrashing . two constables allegedly turned on the group on the pretext of traffic rule violations . a candle light vigil is held for Udit Gayaki in Bhopal .

title: J&K Rajya Sabha poll spat pushes NC-Congress alliance to brink
content: Congress withdrew from next week's Rajya Sabha elections to four seats from J&K . the governing party nominated its fourth candidate, pushing the INDIA bloc partners to the brink of a split . Congress accuses its partner national conference of denying it a ‚Äúsafe seat‚Äù .

title: After Army alert, Baramulla administration bans drones
content: baramulla district administration imposed a complete ban on flying drones in the north Kashmir district until October 31 . intelligence inputs gathered by the army indicated the possible smuggling of unmanned aerial devices (UAVs) into Kashmir Valley and their potential usage against security forces and vital installations .

title: Haryana DGP Shatrujeet Kapur sent on leave amid IPS officer‚Äôs suicide row
content: Ajay Sura is Senior Assistant Editor with The Times of India Chandigarh. He covers news concerning the State of Haryana, Punjab & Haryana High Court and Defence & Military Affairs. He likes to analyse political developments and decoding judicial pronouncements. His hobbies include travelling, mountaineering and trekking. Read More

title: Woman who jumped into well, lover & firefighter killed during rescue attempt in Kollam
content: police identified the deceased as fire and rescue officer Sony s Kumar (36), a resident of Attingal; archana M (34) at Neduvathoor and Sivakrishna S (23) of Kodungalloor, Thrissur .

title: Supreme Court junks plea for probe into 'vote chori' charge, says approach EC
content: the petitioner's counsel told a bench that it is not possible to hold free and fair elections if the electoral rolls are manipulated . the bench of justices Surya Kant and Joymalya Bagchi refrained from commenting on the merits of the issue . a practicing advocate in SC had sought a direction to EC .

title: Sister of Durgapur rape accused on run helps cops nab him
content: the elder sister of the main accused in the alleged gang rape of a medical student in Durgapur helped police track down her absconding brother and arrest him early Monday . the two arrests are now in custody, police say .

title: Push US to lift Chabahar curbs, Afghanistan minister urges policymakers
content: amir Khan Muttaqi urges Indian policymakers to push for the removal of US restrictions on the strategic Chabahar port . the foreign minister also announced direct flights between Amritsar and Kabul and tuesday .

title: Forget jobs, you will lose even your land: BJP on Tejashwi promise
content:
NEW DELHI: BJP on Monday asked voters in Bihar to not fall for RJD functionary Tejashwi Yadav's pledge of a government job to every household if his party is elected to office in state, saying they will never get the promised employment but end up losing their land. BJP's Ravi Shankar Prasad mounted a fresh attack on RJD, including its president Lalu Prasad and his wife Rabri Devi, besides Tejashwi, after a special court framed charges against them in a suspected scam in IRCTC when the RJD supremo was railway minister. "It is a historic day, and corruption of RJD's ruling family has been exposed again," he said. In a swipe at Tejashwi, seen as the chief ministerial face of opposition alliance, Prasad said he is going to change Bihar with the charge of Section 420 of IPC (dealing with cheating). "Eating fodder, drinking bitumen, manipulation in award of govt contracts and acquiring land by promising jobs was Lalu's time-tested model of governance," he alleged.

End of Article

title: Lalu IRCTC scam 'fountainhead', says court as it frames charges

He specializes legal journalism, simplifying court orders, judgments, complex information from Delhi Courts to make it engaging and understandable for readers. Read More

title: ISI-backed smugglers up game, drones can now detect tracking & scoot back
content:
Based in Punjab with journalistic experience of over two decades, Navjeevan Gopal is a senior journalist reporting on crucial issues such as drugs, crime, gangsters, terror and other security issues in the border state. The Punjab Police is one of his core beats. Currently an assistant editor with The Times of India in Punjab Bureau, he comes with a vast experience of over 18 years in The Indian Express, the national daily known for its investigative journalism. Gopal had started his career in journalism with the Hindustan Times as a contributor, gradually moving to The Indian Express and thereafter TOI. He also covers Punjab‚Äôs politics with his area of interests being the 104-year-old party Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) and Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). He also extensively reported on Sikh diaspora settled across the globe.

Read More
